title: P01-1056

sentences.text: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator have recently been proposed , but a fundamental concern is whether the quality of utterances produced with trainable components can compete with hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches .
In this paper We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments .
In order to perform an exhaustive comparison , we also evaluate a hand-crafted template-based generation component , two rule-based sentence planners , and two baseline sentence planners .
We show that the trainable sentence planner performs better than the rule-based systems and the baselines , and as well as the hand-crafted system .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents an experimental evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system, comparing its performance against various hand-crafted and rule-based generation components.

Entity-trainable_sentence_planner.label: trainable sentence planner
Entity-trainable_sentence_planner.description: A trainable sentence planner is an algorithmic component designed to generate coherent and contextually appropriate sentences in dialogue systems, utilizing machine learning techniques to improve its performance based on training data.

Entity-rule-based_sentence_planner.label: rule-based sentence planners
Entity-rule-based_sentence_planner.description: Rule-based sentence planners are computational systems that generate natural language sentences by applying predefined rules and templates to organize and structure content.

Entity-two_rule-based_sentence_planner.label: two rule-based sentence planners
Entity-two_rule-based_sentence_planner.description: The term 'two rule-based sentence planners' refers to two distinct systems designed to generate sentences based on predefined rules, which are evaluated in comparison to other sentence generation methods in the context of a spoken dialogue system.

Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_gener.label: hand-crafted template-based generation component
Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_gener.description: The hand-crafted template-based generation component refers to a specific natural language generation system that utilizes manually created templates to produce utterances, allowing for a controlled and high-quality output in comparison to automated or rule-based systems.

Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_or_ru.label: hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches
Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_or_ru.description: Hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches refer to traditional methods in natural language generation that utilize predefined templates or explicit rules to construct utterances, contrasting with automated or trainable systems.

Entity-trainable_component.label: trainable components
Entity-trainable_component.description: Trainable components refer to modules within a natural language generator that can be automatically trained to produce utterances, allowing for a comparison of their quality against traditional hand-crafted or rule-based systems.

Entity-hand-crafted_system.label: hand-crafted system
Entity-hand-crafted_system.description: The 'hand-crafted system' refers to a template-based generation component used in natural language processing that relies on predefined rules and templates to produce utterances.

Entity-the_quality_of_utterance_produced.label: the quality of utterances produced with trainable components
aliases: the quality of utterances produced with trainable components
Entity-the_quality_of_utterance_produced.description: The quality of utterances produced with trainable components refers to the effectiveness and naturalness of sentences generated by automated systems that utilize machine learning techniques, as opposed to those created through traditional hand-crafted methods.

mentions.local_name: the quality of utterances produced with trainable components

Entity-two_baseline_sentence_planner.label: two baseline sentence planners
Entity-two_baseline_sentence_planner.description: The term 'two baseline sentence planners' refers to a pair of sentence planning systems used as reference points in an experimental evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system, serving to compare the performance of the trainable system against established methods.

Entity-baseline_sentence_planner.label: baseline sentence planners
Entity-baseline_sentence_planner.description: Baseline sentence planners refer to a category of sentence generation systems used as a reference point in comparative evaluations, typically employing simpler or traditional methods for generating sentences in natural language processing tasks.

Entity-technique_for_automatically_train.label: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator
aliases: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator
Entity-technique_for_automatically_train.description: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator refer to methods designed to enhance the performance of natural language generation systems by enabling them to learn from data rather than relying solely on predefined templates or rules.

mentions.local_name: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator

Entity-rule-based_approach.label: rule-based approaches
Entity-rule-based_approach.description: Rule-based approaches are methodologies that utilize predefined rules and templates to generate outputs or make decisions, often employed in natural language processing and generation tasks.

Entity-the_rule-based_system.label: the rule-based systems
Entity-the_rule-based_system.description: The rule-based systems refer to computational frameworks that generate natural language outputs based on predefined rules and templates, as opposed to using machine learning techniques.

Entity-natural_language_generator.label: natural language generator
Entity-natural_language_generator.description: A natural language generator is a type of software or technology that automatically produces human-like text or speech from structured data or predefined rules.

Entity-the_baseline.label: the baselines
Entity-the_baseline.description: The baselines refer to two baseline sentence planners used as comparison points in the evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system.

Entity-quality.label: quality
Entity-quality.description: The term 'quality' refers to the standard or level of excellence of utterances generated by trainable components in a natural language generation system, particularly in comparison to those produced by traditional hand-crafted or rule-based methods.

Entity-an_exhaustive_comparison.label: an exhaustive comparison
Entity-an_exhaustive_comparison.description: An exhaustive comparison refers to a comprehensive evaluation that includes multiple approaches to natural language generation, specifically assessing a trainable sentence planner against a hand-crafted template-based generation component, two rule-based sentence planners, and two baseline sentence planners.

Entity-spoken_dialogue_system.label: spoken dialogue system
Entity-spoken_dialogue_system.description: A spoken dialogue system is an interactive computer system designed to communicate with users through natural language speech, enabling them to perform tasks or obtain information.

Entity-rule-based_system.label: rule-based systems
Entity-rule-based_system.description: Rule-based systems are computational systems that use predefined rules to process information and make decisions, often employed in artificial intelligence and expert systems.

Entity-subjective_human_judgment.label: subjective human judgments
Entity-subjective_human_judgment.description: Subjective human judgments refer to evaluations or assessments made by individuals based on personal opinions, feelings, or interpretations rather than objective criteria.

Entity-utterance.label: utterances
Entity-utterance.description: Utterances refer to the spoken or written expressions produced in communication, often representing the output of linguistic processes.

Entity-baseline.label: baselines
Entity-baseline.description: Baselines refer to standard reference points or comparison systems used to evaluate the performance of new algorithms or systems in research.

summary: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator have recently been proposed , but a fundamental concern is whether the quality of utterances produced with trainable components can compete with hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches . In this paper We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments . In order to perform an exhaustive comparison , we also evaluate a hand-crafted template-based generation component , two rule-based sentence planners , and two baseline sentence planners . We show that the trainable sentence planner performs better than the rule-based systems and the baselines , and as well as the hand-crafted system .

Predicate-have_been_proposed.label: have been proposed
Predicate-have_been_proposed.description: The predicate 'have been proposed' indicates that the subject has been suggested or recommended as a potential solution, method, or idea related to the object. It implies that there is a consideration or discussion surrounding the subject in the context of the object, often within a theoretical, academic, or practical framework.

Predicate-can_compete_with.label: can compete with
Predicate-can_compete_with.description: The predicate 'can compete with' indicates a relationship where the subject possesses qualities, capabilities, or performance levels that are comparable to those of the object. It suggests that the subject is able to match or rival the object in terms of effectiveness, efficiency, or other relevant criteria, implying a level of parity or equivalence in their respective domains.

Predicate-have_been_proposed_(1).label: have been proposed
Predicate-have_been_proposed_(1).description: The predicate 'have been proposed' indicates that the subject has been suggested or recommended as a potential solution, method, or idea related to the object. It implies that there is a consideration or discussion surrounding the subject in the context of its applicability or relevance to the object, often within a theoretical, academic, or practical framework.

Predicate-evaluates.label: evaluates
Predicate-evaluates.description: The predicate 'evaluates' signifies an assessment or analysis performed by the subject on the object. It indicates that the subject is examining, measuring, or determining the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the object in a systematic manner.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' indicates a purpose or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject serves a specific function or is designed to fulfill a role that benefits or supports the object.

Predicate-elicits.label: elicits
Predicate-elicits.description: The predicate 'elicits' indicates an action or process by which the subject provokes, draws out, or stimulates a response, reaction, or information from the object. It suggests an interaction where the subject actively engages with the object to obtain specific insights, feedback, or data, often related to perceptions, feelings, or evaluations.

Predicate-is_evaluated_by.label: is evaluated by
Predicate-is_evaluated_by.description: The predicate 'is evaluated by' establishes a relationship where the subject undergoes an assessment or appraisal process conducted by the entity represented by the object. This indicates that the quality, performance, or effectiveness of the subject is determined through the criteria or standards set by the object, which often involves subjective or objective measures of evaluation.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: The predicate 'evaluate' signifies the action of assessing, analyzing, or appraising the subject in relation to the object. It implies a process where the subject, which can be an entity, system, or method, undergoes scrutiny or judgment against the criteria or standards represented by the object. This relationship often involves determining the effectiveness, quality, or performance of the subject based on the characteristics or outcomes described by the object.

Predicate-is_evaluated_in.label: is evaluated in
Predicate-is_evaluated_in.description: The predicate 'is evaluated in' establishes a relationship where the subject undergoes a process of assessment or analysis within the context or framework defined by the object. It indicates that the subject is being examined, tested, or compared against certain criteria, standards, or methodologies represented by the object, thereby facilitating an understanding of the subject's performance, effectiveness, or quality.

Predicate-are_evaluated_in.label: are evaluated in
Predicate-are_evaluated_in.description: The predicate 'are evaluated in' indicates a process in which the subject is subjected to a systematic assessment or analysis within the context of the object. This implies that the subject is being measured, compared, or judged based on specific criteria or standards outlined in the object, which represents the framework or setting for the evaluation.

Predicate-performs_better_than.label: performs better than
Predicate-performs_better_than.description: The predicate 'performs better than' establishes a comparative relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject exhibits superior performance, effectiveness, or efficiency in a particular context or task when compared to the object. This comparison suggests that the subject achieves more favorable outcomes, results, or metrics than the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the wider category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a broader scope or definition that includes the subject, thereby situating the subject within a larger conceptual framework.
